title: Testnet support for API [NFT-MAKER]
description: When onboarding developers to NFT-MAKER PRO, they have to spend real ADA to test the API.

f6_assessments.q0: This seems like a great idea to upgrade an existing app. It would be good for the proposers to give some details on current usage of their Pro app so the community can gauge the impact this would have. How many developers are using your App?
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers have a current product which has been running since 2017 thus there is not reason to doubt they would be able to add this functionality. It would be good to have more of a budget breakdown as to why is 15,000 the right amount of funding to achieve this? How much work is actually involved
f6_assessments.q2: Delivery off the functionality within the proposed 1 month is relatively easy to audit. More importantly success of the proposal really relies on the impact this will have. The proposers should provide some information on how many developers are using their paid app, i.e how many people will this impact? Do they expect this to draw more developers into using their product and thus minting NFT's on Cardano? What is the total addressable market here?

f6_assessments.q0: MInting NFT through NFT-MAKER PRO is site-specific. Moreover, it is not offering any open-source solutions to enable the community to Mint/Market NFTs. Developers are using custom tools for minting and generally avoided third-party sites for minting. Therefore this proposal to have NFT-MAKER in the test net is not likely to improve the developer Cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer is currently operating a sucessfull NFT Minting site on a cost basis. Therefore they have established credentials to host a mirror site on testnet.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposers have a running site working on mainnet. The money needed to create a mirror site in the testnet looks very high since it involves hosting one more machine with a change in node parameters to point to the testnet. The traffic in testnet is not expected to be that high. The cost is justified only if the complete code base is released with some open source license which is not included in the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is based on an existing NFT platform. The proposer is asking for fund to integrate Cardano testnet support into this platform. My question here is: Is it product/application specific proposal or is it for the developer ecosystem in general? As the proposer does not provide much information about this, the impact on our ecosystem and the challenge matching remains unclear.
f6_assessments.q1: The provided information is very simple: Integrate testnet support. In order to give a higher rating for feasibility the proposer should provide much more details about this. At least some technical details should be shared. Also the budget is not broken down in details. From my professional standpoint, the requested amount is reasonable. At least we know that Tobias has already contributed to our ecosystem and seems to be capable of delivering this proposal, therefore I rate feasibility with 4 stars (but IMHO: It seems almost disrespectful to the community to provide so little information, even if you have already delivered).
f6_assessments.q2: Auditablity asks for metrics to measure the success of a project but Tobias doesn't provide much context for his proposal: how many users does he want to reach with this solution?  At least there is a clear date when the result can be expected. With a clear target, success would be more measurable. Also, it would be helpful if there is a public visible documentation that shows the community the progress of the project.

solution: By integrating testnet support into NFT-MAKER PRO, we want to provide an easier entry point for new developers to work with Cardano NFTs.
experience: Our team is behind NFT-MAKER and NFT-MAKER PRO - the two most used NFT creation tools on Cardano. In the Cardano space since 2017.
